intro: Erigeron thunbergii var. heterotrichus, commonly known as the New Zealand fleabane, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas, and it is known for its fluffy, white to pale blue flower heads that appear in spring. It has hairy stems and leaves, which are often glandular and can produce a mild scent. This variety is distinguished by its unique leaf arrangement and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
